intro: Ficus drupacea var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fig, is a species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree characterized by its glossy, smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered figs that are typically green when immature and turn yellow or red when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in garden settings.
